arts.ttl: Post Match Observations: Dortmund Concede Late Equalizer, Draw Bayern 1-1
arts.sum: Dortmund overcame a nervy start and grabbed a go-ahead goal courtesy of Jamie Gittens, before bunkering down and holding on for dear life as Bayern upped the pressure. Borussia Dortmund, held without their best player and short on reinforcements, still somehow stood toe-to-toe with their Bavarian rivals, playing them to a 1-1 draw that, all things considered, was probably a fair result.

arts.ttl: After injury in Der Klassiker, Bayern Munich star Harry Kane’s status uncertain ahead of Bayer Leverkusen showdown
arts.sum: Bayern Munich star striker Harry Kane went down in the 33rd minute of the team’s 1-1 draw with Borussia Dortmund and now his status is uncertain for Tuesday’s DFB-Pokal match with Bayer Leverkusen. He now needs to have a scan, and then we’ll know more,” said Kompany .

arts.ttl: Jamal Musiala talks about Bayern Munich’s mentality following 1-1 draw against Borussia Dortmund
arts.sum: Thanks to a late equalizer through a Jamal Musiala header, Bayern Munich stumbled to a 1-1 draw against Borussia Dortmund in the season’s first edition of Der Klassiker. Speaking post-game, Musiala discussed the team’s performance and what led to the Bayern goal.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Mathys Tel doesn’t take advantage of big opportunity vs. Borussia Dortmund
arts.sum: Tel has become a hot topic within transfer rumors as Bayern have started to explore a six-month loan deal that would guarantee him more playing time. In a surprise move, Bayern boss Vincent Kompany has decided to reward Mathys Tel’s perseverance with his first start since the Freiburg win back in September.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich vs. Bayer Leverkusen: DFB Cup probable teams, match stats and LIVE blog!
arts.sum: Bayer have been far more consistent in cup competition, beating Carl-Zeiss Jena and Elversberg by an aggregate score of 4-0 in the opening rounds, and winning three of their first five in the revamped Champions League . Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich host DFB Cup holders Bayer Leverkusen in a huge last-16 encounter at the Allianz Arena on Tuesday (kick-off: 8.45pm CET).

arts.ttl: Jamie Gittens and Jamal Musiala mesmerise as Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich produce Klassiker to remember
arts.sum: The 111th Der Klassiker lived up to its billing as two of the youngest stars of the world game – Jamie Gittens and Jamal Musiala – made it a night to remember for fans of both sides in a pulsating contest between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich that ended 1-1. For the first time, Gittens found the net in a third straight game in Black-and-Yellow in all competitions while his fourth in the Bundesliga this term represents a new personal best for a single season.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works: Postgame Show — Borussia Dortmund 1-1 Bayern Munich (Bundesliga — Der Klassiker)
arts.sum: What Harry Kane’s injury means and why Bayern Munich could be in for some trouble. Bayern Munich travelled to Borussia Dortmund for Der Klassiker in a match that was very key for both squads.

arts.ttl: Six Observations from Bayern Munich’s 1-1 draw against Borussia Dortmund
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany started Mathys Tel after almost never playing him and had to call on Thomas Müller after not giving him any real game time ever since the defeat against Barcelona considering that he is essentially a fill in for two players (Jamal Musiala and Harry Kane). Bayern has played Eintracht Frankfurt, Bayer Leverkusen and Borussia Dortmund so far; aside from RB Leipzig, they have played everyone in the top five and collectively earned zero wins.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich’s entertaining draw
arts.sum: After sitting under intense pressure from the visitors for 26 minutes, Schlotterbeck sensed the one weak link in the Bayern backline – Konrad Laimer’s pace against the wily Jamie Gittens. Creating four chances and having six dribbles past a menacing Dortmund side, Musiala was the core of the Bayern attack.

arts.ttl: Sahin and Jablonski decline fight over late Bayern equalizer
arts.sum: Stopping in at the Sky Sports desk after the full-time whistle, BVB trainer Nuri Sahin stood alongside match-official Sven Jablonski to discuss Saturday's result.
